content.caption: Endless Runner Game Template with Motion Matching (v1.3)

content.value: Getting Started

This document serves as a comprehensive guide to the Infinite Runner Template, which has been integrated with Motion Matching. The template provides a robust framework for creating endless runner games in Unreal Engine, featuring dynamic obstacle generation, character selection, customization, and power-up systems.
Support: For questions or assistance, please leave a comment on the product page or join the Discord server. Please consider rating and reviewing the asset if it proves useful.

Track the progress as the project upgrades.
  • Green items are live,
  • Blue are currently being worked on
  • and Yellow are planned for future releases.

features: Dynamic Obstacles (can be slid under or climbed)
Added Toggle Control for various features
Added Theme based Spawn Zone System (Sequential & Random)
Added Stability Controls for First Person Camera
Added Roll on Forced Jump Ends
Added Emoting Mechanic on Character Selection Screen
Parkour can now be disabled on certain obstacles
Added New Demo Maps - RunnerMap(Default), DayMap and NightMap
Updated Character Selection System to Version 1.2
Updated Character Customization System to Version 1.1
Updated Widgets Management System to Version 1.1

content.value: Prerequisites
Motion Matching: This project uses the customized setup from the GameAnimationSampleProject (GASP) for Motion Matching. No new motion matching setup was specifically created for this project.

The default setup has been modified to improve gameplay fluidity. But you will need to add  specific animations to improve the results. The existing GASP animations have been repurposed for various actions.
Project Settings

Required Plugins:
  • Animation: AnimationWarping, MotionWarping, AnimationLocomotionLibrary, PoseSearch, Chooser, RigLogic, LiveLink, LiveLinkControlRig.
  • Tools: ModelingToolsEditorMode, HairStrands, Mover, NetworkPrediction.
Collision: A new object trace channel called "Collectibles" has been added (Default Behavior: Ignore).
GameModeVariant: A new game mode variant of infinite runner - Vector, has been added to the project.
Save Game Data

• No Save Data: The project does not use a GameInstanceClass. Data is not saved between levels or game replays.
  • Customization Reset: Any customization items attached to a character are lost if the character is changed.
Integration Strategy
The project is intended to be used as a base starting project.
Miscellaneous
UI: Record Label and Value in the top-right corner of screen is partially implemented. As long as you do not change levels, the value of record will be updated and read from gameMode.

Migration Guide: The system is heavily interface-driven. Though modular, this project is not intended for migration into existing projects. However, you can easily download and integrate CharacterSelectionSystem, Customization System, and WidgetsManagementSystem selectively from FAB for free.
Systems
Integrated Character Selection System V1.2, Character Customization System V1.1, Widgets Management System V1.1 out of the box.
Game Modes

• Normal (Runner) Mode 3 Lane FP/TP Runner
  • Vector Mode Single Lane Sidescroller Infinite Runner
PowerUps

• 5 Preset powerUps - SuperJump, Invincibility, Magnet, DoubleCoins, ScoreBooster.
  • PowerUps attachments for visual indication.
  • Improved PowerUp management logic.
  • Fixed bugs related to invincibility.
Animations

• New Character Animation Modification System that can be easily extended to micro-control creation and modification of existing animations for unique character animations by blending each body part with an unique animation during an action.
  • The traversal animations chooser has been modified to include only run-related traversal animations.
  • A copy of original traversal animation chooser is also present for reference to add new animations.
Camera System

• Improved blending, transitions, and added a settings toggle in the main menu.
  • Camera animations on character customization screen based on the customization category.
  • Stability Control with First Person Camera.
  • Play LevelSequences in background of the widget screens.
Platforms

• SpawnZones based platform spawning (Sequential and Random).
  • Modified obstacle spawning logic on static platforms.
  • Modified Random platforms spawning logic.
Environment Creation Tools:

• Environment Creation Tools have been included in the project.
  • Support for both static and animatable skeletal meshes.
  • Control over how far from the player, the skeletal mesh animation plays.
  • Ability to create environments separately and attach them to platforms or you can create environments on the fly unique to a platform.
UI Improvements

• Revamped various menu layouts.
  • Added Pause Menu.
  • Uses DebugTABKey in CBP_SandboxCharacter to create widget. Will not appear in final game builds until changed to any other normal input key.
Quality of Life:

• More toggle controls over gameplay mechanics,
  • Mesh attachements when PowerUps are equipped,
  • Spawned PowerUps Indicator,
  • Roll mechanic on forced jump ends.
  • Control movement sensitivity in First Person Camera.
  • Obstacles and Collectibles Spawning logic updated.
  • Reorganized blueprints and commented code for better readability.
  • Fixed some collision issues.
  • Solved the issue of disappearing mouse cursor on widget screens.
Gameplay Controls

• Space: Jump / Air-Parkour
  • C: Slide
  • A: Move Left
  • D: Move Right
Platform Architecture
The world is built using a hierarchy of blueprints controlled by GM_Runner.
BP_Floor: Holds the reference for spawning platforms.
B P_MapBase: The base class for all platforms (floor and side walls).

• Never spawn BP_MapBase directly.
  • Use Child Classes (BPSP_ or BPCC_) to spawn platforms with specific obstacle logic.
  • It is intended for common platform properties.

BPCC_ObstacleBase: Spawns obstacles via ChildActorComponents (Dynamic Obstacle Families).
BPSP_ObstacleBase: Spawns fixed, pre-configured obstacles (Static).
Spawning Logic

The BP_RunnerGM manages the infinite loop:
1. AddFloor: Spawns initial tiles.
2. ExtendFloor: Spawns new tile when player overlaps detector.
3. DeleteFloor: Removes oldest tile to maintain performance.
Spawn Zones
Platforms can be grouped into Zones (e.g., City, Forest). You can set them to cycle Sequentially or Randomly using Data Assets (PDA).
Obstacle Families

Obstacles are grouped into families to allow variation.
• Blocking: Walls, Cars (WorldDynamic collision).
• UnderRolls: High barriers (PhysicsBody collision).
BP_DynamicObstacles: This class dynamically spawns obstacles from a selected family at specific lane indices.
BP_EnvironmentBase

This tool allows you to create complex environments using PropsData maps.
  • UseRandomSeedValues: Randomizes transform within min/max ranges.
  • AutoUpdatePropsData: Updates viewport in real-time.
  • PropsData: Supports both Static Meshes (Instanced) and Skeletal Meshes (Animated).
CBP_SandboxCharacter
Handles movement, lane logic, and input detection.
Attributes Component

SpeedUpdateRate: Score required to increase speed.
Lane Settings: Controls lane width and switching speed.
Death Logic: Checks for 'DeathTracer' collision and triggers ragdoll.
Parkour Component
Uses Motion Warping to adapt animations. Handles Sliding, Rolling, and Bump reactions based on collision strength.
Available Power-Ups

• DoubleCoins: Multiplies coin value by 2.
  • Invincibility: Phases through obstacles.
  • Magnet: Increases collection radius.
  • SuperJump: Allows extremely high jumps.
Management
Managed by BPC_PowerUpsManager. Only one power-up is active at a time. Picking up a new one overwrites the current effect.
Character System
All characters must inherit from CBP_SandboxCharacter to preserve running logic. Data is fetched from `DA_PDA_CD` assets.
Adding New Characters

1. Create Child Class of CBP_SandboxCharacter.
2. Assign Skeletal Mesh.
3. Create new Data Asset and add to `DA_PDA_CSD`.
4. Setup sockets (hat, glasses, backpack) on the skeleton.
Modes

Third Person (TPS): Standard runner view.
First Person (FPS): Attached to head bone with dynamic stabilization.
Rigs: Specific camera rigs are triggered for actions (Slide, Roll) and Menus.
Widget Management

Uses WidgetsManagementSystem with reusable elements (E_Button, E_FixedText).
Workflow: Create Widget -> Define Category in Enum -> Add to Data Asset -> Call `AddWidgetToScreen` interface.
Play in a New Level

1. File -> New Level (Basic).
2. Add BP_PlatformManager and PlayerStart at (0,0,0).
3. Set GameMode to BP_RunnerGM.
4. Press Play.
